reference_summary:
Green Lantern
Ryan Reynolds  (Actor),     Blake Lively  (Actor),     Martin Campbell  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Warner Home Video, All Titles
['Product Description', "In a universe as vast as it is mysterious, an elite force of protectors for peace and justice has existed for centuries. They are the Green Lantern Corps. When a new enemy called Parallax threatens to destroy the Universe, their fate and the fate of Earth lie in the hands of the Corps' newest recruit, the first human ever selected: Hal Jordan (Ryan Reynolds). Bringing the popular superhero to the big screen for the first time, Green Lantern also stars Blake Lively (", 'Gossip Girl', '), Peter Sarsgaard (', 'Orphan', '), Mark Strong (', 'Sherlock Holmes', '), Academy Award® nominee Angela Bassett* and Academy Award® winner Tim Robbins**.', 'Amazon.com', 'As far as superheroes go, Green Lantern may lack the clean, iconic lines of his more respectable DC counterparts Superman and Batman, but the very wonkiness of the premise (earthling joins elite force of space cops) lends itself to a pulpy, operatic, not-entirely-serious approach. (One of his teammates is a talking carrot, after all.) Capitalizing on a charming performance by Ryan Reynolds, the feature-film adaptation is a big, messy movie that, at its best, generates a feeling of aw-shucks wonder. Much like', 'Thor', ", it isn't afraid to loosen up on the inner turmoil of its hero and go macro. Based on comic writer Geoff Johns's retrofitting of the title character, the story follows Hal Jordan (Reynolds), an impulsive test pilot whose encounter with a dying alien leaves him with an energy ring capable of weaponizing his imagination. While struggling to master his will-based powers, he must deal with threats both earthbound (a hilariously nebbishy Peter Saarsgard, who may be the first supervillain to rock a hoodie) and galactic. Martin Campbell, a director who specializes in more down-to-earth heroics (", 'Casino Royale', ',', 'The Mask of Zorro', '), brings a pleasing matter-of-fact baseline to the proceedings, an approach that makes the increasingly outlandish effects truly feel special when they occur.', 'Green Lantern', 'has its debits, certainly--the lack of a memorable theme, a second act that hems and haws before getting to the action, the standard origin story shoehorning in too many secondary plots--but its final scenes succeed on a Gigantor, cosmic level where most superhero movies fear to tread. The bigger it goes, the more goofily enjoyable it gets.', '--Andrew Wright']
{'Genre': 'Science Fiction & Fantasy, Action & Adventure', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Martin Campbell, Ryan Reynolds, Blake Lively', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '114 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.6 x 5.3 x 7.5 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'MFR883929140237#VG', 'Director': 'Martin Campbell', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '114 minutes', 'Release date': 'October 14, 2011', 'Actors': 'Ryan Reynolds, Blake Lively', 'Studio': 'Warner Bros. Pictures', 'Number of discs': '1'}
If you are into comics as a child you will love the movie I watched it 5 times 1st day still want to see it...
LOVE THIS MOVIE
Pixar Short Films Collection Volume 2
Rated:    G    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Walt Disney Studios Home Entertainment, All Disney Titles
['Product Description', 'Disney and Pixar present an incredible new collection of 12 short films, featuring multiple Academy Award(R) nominees (Best Short Film, Animated: "Presto," 2008; "Day & Night," 2010; "La Luna," 2011) and a host of family favorites. Join the celebration of imagination with this must-own collection, packed with unforgettable animation, fantastic stories and captivating characters. Plus, enjoy all-new extras that share how Pixar\'s storied talent got their start -- including student films from acclaimed directors John Lasseter, Andrew Stanton and Pete Docter!', 'Brand Story', 'By']

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Interests**: The user maintains a strong preference for superhero movies, action-adventure films, and animated features, particularly from Disney and Pixar. Recent interactions highlight a fondness for family-friendly content, especially short films that cater to all ages.

- **Viewing Habits**: The user continues to deeply engage with favorite films, rewatching them for personal enjoyment and to share with family, emphasizing their appreciation for imaginative, entertaining narratives suitable for children and adults alike.

- **Appreciation for Stars**: The user enjoys performances from well-known actors that evoke emotional resonance and high entertainment value, with notable interest in family-oriented productions.

- **Reviewing Style**: The user exhibits a distinctly positive sentiment in recent reviews, showcasing enthusiasm and enjoyment, particularly with nostalgic and entertaining animated films. Their recent review reflects excitement about delightful short stories that appeal to their family.

- **Rating Trends**: Consistently high ratings indicate a preference for films that inspire wonder and amusement, often tied to fond childhood memories.

- **Overall Vibe**: The user favors movies that balance humor and adventure, demonstrating an affinity for narratives rich in creativity and family fun. They embrace captivating storytelling across various formats while cherishing themes of joy and togetherness with loved ones.
